With the help of maverick CIA agent Gustav Avrakotos, Wilson dedicates his canny political efforts to supply the Afghan mujahideen with the weapons and support to defeat the Soviet Union.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: This highly acclaimed, Oscar® winning independent drama marked the extraordinary sophomore effort of writer and director Sofia Coppola, who crafts a resonant, understated drama about a movie star (Bill Murray) visiting Tokyo to appear in a liquor commercial, who befriends the lonely, hotel-bound wife (Scarlett Johansson) of a celebrity photographer. Together, the two lost, culturally adrift, insomniac Americans become platonic soul mates, exploring the city and discovering a kindred spirit to combat their shared isolation.(n)

programme.title: Special AFI Life Achievement Award A Tribute to George Clooney
programme.desc: George Clooney is honored with the American Film Institute's Life Achievement Award. Among those paying tribute: Don Cheadle, Bill Murray, Anna Kendrick, Cate Blanchett and Amal Clooney. (repeat).

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou?
programme.desc: Quirky Coen brothers effort follows Depression-era convicts who escape a Mississippi chain gang and embark on an odyssey to find a hidden treasure. (cc).

programme.title: Special AFI Life Achievement Award A Tribute to George Clooney
programme.desc: George Clooney is honored with the American Film Institute's Life Achievement Award. Among those paying tribute: Don Cheadle, Bill Murray, Anna Kendrick, Cate Blanchett and Amal Clooney. (repeat).

programme.title: Up in the Air
programme.desc: Ryan Bingham works for a company that specializes in firing people, and he's forced to take a newcomer named Natalie along on a business trip in order to show her firsthand what he does. Along the way, Ryan begins to reflect on his lonely life and develops a relationship with fellow frequent flyer Alex Goran. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Roger & Me
programme.desc: Seriocomic essay on General Motors plant closings in Flint, Michigan, which left thousands unemployed. The target for satire is GM chairman Roger Smith.

programme.title: Death of a Salesman
programme.desc: An aging door-to-door salesman loses his job and begins to contemplate suicide. He also faces up to some uncomfortable truths about his son. (cc).

programme.title: Room Service
programme.desc: A theatre producer and his staff don't have enough money to bring their latest play out of rehearsals, or to pay their hotel bills. Under the threat of eviction, the trio struggle to outsmart the hotel manager and get their play to the stage. From the play by John Murray and Allen Boretz. (cc).

programme.title: Grand Hotel
programme.desc: This Best Picture winner charts 24 hours in the lives of guests at a plush Berlin hostelry, where a down-on-his-luck thief covets a ballerina's pearls, while lusting after the mistress of a businessman whose dying bookkeeper is tended by a drunken doctor. (cc).

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: A country roadhouse in Connecticut is turned into a nightclub 15 times a year in this stylish and snappy Bing Crosby-Fred Astaire musical that introduced "White Christmas," which won an Oscar for Best Song. The Oscar-nominated soundtrack features a wealth of Irving Berlin tunes including "Easter Parade" and "Happy Holiday." The Holiday Inn hotel chain took its name from the film's title. (cc).

programme.title: Hotel Reserve
programme.desc: Spies and intrigue at a French resort. James Mason. Duclos: Raymond Lovell. Suzanne: Lucie Mannheim. Odette: Patricia Medina. Andre: Herbert Lom. Beghin: Julian Mitchell. Mary: Clare Hamilton. Vogel: Martin Miller. Fair suspense. Directed by Lance Comfort. (cc).

programme.title: Honeymoon Hotel
programme.desc: Two bachelors on the loose at a hotel catering to newlyweds. Robert Goulet, Robert Morse. Lynn: Nancy Kwan. Sherry: Jill St. John. Sampson: Keenan Wynn. Cynthia: Anne Helm. Chambermaid: Elsa Lanchester. Directed by Henry Levin. (cc).

programme.title: Hotel Berlin
programme.desc: Life among a cross section of characters carrying on at a hotel near the end of the Nazi regime. The film is an adaptation of a novel by Vicki Baum, who wrote the similarly themed "Grand Hotel." (cc).

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: Remake of 1932's "Grand Hotel" chronicles the hopes, fears and happiness of guests at New York's famed Waldorf-Astoria on Park Avenue. (cc).

programme.title: Within Our Gates
programme.desc: A black teacher from the South heads to Boston to seek funds for her impoverished school and finds racism and treachery. Copies of this silent drama were lost for years until one turned up in 1990 Spain and was restored by the Smithsonian Institute.

programme.title: Imitation of Life
programme.desc: A widow (Claudette Colbert) builds up a business, aided by a black woman (Louise Beavers) with an incorrigible daughter (Fredi Washington). Stephen: Warren William. Jessie: Rochelle Hudson. Elmer: Ned Sparks. Martin: Alan Hale. Well-acted version of Fannie Hurst's novel. Directed by John M. Stahl. (cc).

programme.title: Pinky
programme.desc: Jeanne Crain received a Best Actress nomination as a light-skinned black nurse who passes for white in the South, where she is plagued by a number of personal conflicts and racial problems. (cc).

programme.title: Daughters of the Dust
programme.desc: Ensemble drama set in 1902 about a community of descendants of West African slaves living on an island off of South Carolina. The story revolves around a picnic celebrating a few former islanders who chose to move north.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee about three Navy lawyers charged with defending two marines accused of killing a third during a disciplinary action at the U.S. base in Guantanamo, Cuba. (cc).

programme.title: Son of Sinbad
programme.desc: Sinbad (Dale Robertson) is out to defeat the forces of Tamarlane. Ameer: Sally Forrest. Kristina: Mari Blanchard. Omar: Vincent Price. Nerissa: Lili St. Cyr. Ted Tetzlaff directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Bribe
programme.desc: An FBI agent sets out to track down war-surplus racketeers in Central America, only to fall for a shady woman who is involved in the criminal activity. (cc).

programme.title: The Big Circus
programme.desc: The owner of a foundering circus is beset by financial woes and a saboteur, who causes not only setbacks but, ultimately, death. (cc).

programme.title: The Long Night
programme.desc: A soldier at gunpoint reminisces about the situations that led him there, from falling in love to a murder. (cc).

programme.title: Dangerous Mission
programme.desc: A murder witness (Piper Laurie) is sought by both killer and police in this chase yarn. Matt: Victor Mature. Parker: William Bendix. Adams: Vincent Price. Betta St. John. Dennis Weaver. Colorful scenery of Glacier National Park. Originally shown in 3-D. (cc).

programme.title: The Bat
programme.desc: The remote mansion owned by a mystery novelist holds many secrets within the foreboding grounds, and the guests are all at the mercy of a crazed menace. (cc).

programme.title: The Las Vegas Story
programme.desc: A robbery scheme set to take place in Las Vegas results in murder, and a woman and her new husband encounter her ex, a policeman trying to crack the case. (cc).

programme.title: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
programme.desc: Chronicling the romance England's Elizabeth I and Lord Essex, and its breakdown from pride and court intrigue. (cc).

programme.title: Living It Up
programme.desc: Jerry Lewis plays the supposedly doomed character created by Carole Lombard in “Nothing Sacred.” Dean Martin, Janet Leigh, Edward Arnold, Fred Clark, Sheree North, Sig Ruman. Entertaining remake. Directed by Norman Taurog.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood or Bust
programme.desc: A gambler and a crazed movie fan take a cross-country automobile trip to meet a movie starlet.(n)

programme.title: At War With the Army
programme.desc: A swaggering Romeo and his bumbling sidekick join the Army and wreak havoc during basic training.(n)

programme.title: Ten Thousand Bedrooms
programme.desc: When a wealthy hotel man acquires an Italian property with ten thousand bedrooms, he has to see it in person. Soon the man finds himself tangled with two beautiful sisters, each vying for his eye. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Who Was That Lady?
programme.desc: A professor tells his wife he's on an undercover mission for the FBI after she catches him kissing one of his female students. She believes him and soon they are caught up in a plot involving the real FBI and enemy spies. Based on the play "Who Was That Lady I Saw You With?" by Norman Krasna. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Bells Are Ringing
programme.desc: Judy Holliday has a field day re-creating her Broadway role as an answering-service operator who makes a personal connection in the social lives of her customers, one of whom she falls for. An Oscar-nominated Musical Score includes "Just in Time" and "The Party's Over." (cc).(n)

programme.title: I Take This Woman
programme.desc: Marital woes follow a doctor who weds a beautiful European refugee who still carries a torch for a married man who threw her over. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Men in White
programme.desc: Version of Sidney Kingsley's play about a dedicated doctor (Clark Gable) and his romantic and professional problems. Laura: Myrna Loy. Barbara: Elizabeth Allan. Hochberg: Jean Hersholt. Levine: Otto Kruger. Cunningham: C. Henry Gordon. Michaelson: Russell Hardie. Shorty: Wallace Ford. Pete: Russell Hopton. McCabe: Henry B. Walthall. Directed by Richard Boleslavsky. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Knockout
programme.desc: Tough tale of the efforts of a young boxer (Arthur Kennedy) to best a ruthless fight manager (Anthony Quinn) and retire. Angela: Olympe Bradna. Gloria: Virginia Field. Pinky: Cliff Edwards. Rossi: Cornel Wilde. Well-acted. Directed by William Clemens.(n)

programme.title: The World Changes
programme.desc: Paul Muni is excellent in this saga of a Dakota farmer who rises to wealth and prominence in the meat-packing industry. Anna: Aline MacMahon. Virginia: Mary Astor. Richard: Donald Cook. Jarrett: Alan Dinehart. Jennifer: Margaret Lindsay. Claflin: Guy Kibbee. Selma: Jean Muir. Natalie: Patricia Ellis. Mrs. Peterson: Anna Q. Nilsson. Fine cast, expert direction (Mervyn LeRoy).(n)

programme.title: Oil for the Lamps of China
programme.desc: A salesman and inventor with a U.S. oil company is sent to China to reach that nation's untapped market. After his fiancée leaves him, he marries a woman he's only just met because he's already arranged to bring a wife to China, and together they endure the toll of living abroad. (cc).(n)

programme.title: An American Romance
programme.desc: The rise of an immigrant (Brian Donlevy) from steel mills to executive's chair. Anna: Ann Richards. Clinton: Walter Abel. Anton: John Qualen. Ted: Horace McNally. Directed by King Vidor.(n)

programme.title: The Power and the Prize
programme.desc: An American business executive working in England wants to marry a European refugee, but is warned by his controlling boss that such things just aren't done, leading to a standoff over the romance. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Hunger Games Mockingjay, Part 2
programme.desc: In the fourth and final installment of the "Hunger Games" saga, Katniss and her allies face their biggest challenge yet as the uprising sets its sights on revenge against President Snow during its siege of the Capitol. Meanwhile, Katniss must also deal with her brainwashed ex-lover and tensions with her current beau. (cc).

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: Jodie Foster plays a recently widowed engineer whose daughter mysteriously vanishes during a flight from Berlin to New York City. Well-made but implausible thriller. Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean, Kate Beahan. Directed by Robert Schwentke. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Ka Pono Ku'oko'a (The Cost of Freedom)
programme.desc: Five-0 goes on a manhunt when a chemical spill permits six dangerous inmates to escape, including Kono's husband, Adam. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: I'ike Ke Ao (For the World to Know)
programme.desc: Five-0 tries to save a kidnapped college student from a dangerous vigilante. Meanwhile, Max, Kamekona and Flippa fight to survive after being shipwrecked. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in her home and Five-0 learns that one of their own has a deep connection to the victim's young daughter. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Pa'a Ka 'Ipuka I Ka 'Upena Nananana (The Entrance Is Stopped With a Spider's Web)
programme.desc: Five-0 gets trapped inside a dilapidated building in Oahu's Chinatown, where they try to protect a wounded Gabriel and plan their escape. But gunmen looking to kill Gabriel storm the building. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Five-0 hunts a Russian spy who stole a flash drive containing classified NSA information that puts one of their own at risk. Meanwhile, McGarrett learns why Catherine left him; and Abby continues to conceal her actual mission from Chin and Five-0. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The sisters go before a magic tribunal to save the life of Det. Morris after the Cleaners cover up evidence of magical activity by making it appear that the cop killed a suspect in cold blood. Meanwhile, Chris must set aside his feelings for Leo in order to help the elder find information that could aid the sisters' case. Gideon: Gildart Jackson. Cleaner #1: Kirk Woller. Cleaner #2: Darin Cooper. Barbas: Billy Drago. Chris: Drew Fuller. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: A Wrong Day's Journey into Right
programme.desc: Paige conjures up a dream man to help relieve her stress, but she also unknowingly creates his evil twin, who sets his sights on winning her heart---at any cost. Elsewhere, Chris is arrested for a crime he didn't commit, but Lt. Morris refuses to help him get out of this jam. Mr. Right: Gabriel Olds. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Two demons create a reality show in which demonic contestants hunt witches, and one of the sisters' trusted friends exploits the program to hide his efforts to kill Wyatt. Elsewhere, Phoebe uses her feminine wiles to get a nerdy reporter to help her figure out who is after her nephew. Gideon: Gildart Jackson. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: It's a Bad, Bad, Bad, Bad World
programme.desc: Part 1 of two. Leo and Chris inadvertently enter a parallel universe where evil reigns, leading to a rescue attempt by Phoebe and Paige that pits the women against their evil twins. Barbas: Billy Drago. Gideon: Gildart Jackson. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Lovers start killing each other on Valentine's Day, and Sam and Dean believe Cupid is responsible, so they attempt to track him down. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean visit Bobby's hometown, where the dead are returning to life and reuniting with their families. But soon the zombies turn evil, and Bobby is faced with having to kill his undead wife. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean are fatally shot and go to heaven, where they encounter some old friends and family members, and search for an angel named Joshua who can help them return to Earth. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean are rescued from demons by townspeople preparing for the apocalypse. They meet a pastor's daughter who claims to be a prophet, but she turns local citizens against each other, and the brothers must decide whether she should be killed. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean are horrified when they learn of the angels' new plans, and the brothers take on Zachariah to prevent a war on Earth. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Eagle Eye

When Miller realizes that operatives on both sides of the conflict are attempting to spin the story in their favor, he searches for the facts that will either absolve a rogue regime or take the war to the next level. (cc).

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the popular video-game series, a death-row convict relives his ancestor's memories as an assassin in 15th-century Spain. From this out-of-body experience, he gains the training he needs to battle a conspiracy in the present day. (cc).

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric) during a mission in the Bolivian jungle. But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (cc).

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
programme.desc: Dramatic fantasy about a librarian whose genetic disorder causes him to hurtle through time when under extreme duress. Despite this condition, he tries to build a relationship with a young heiress. Based on the best-selling novel by author Audrey Niffenegger. (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future. (cc).

programme.title: Austin Powers The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: The series' second entry sends Austin Powers, the international man of mystery, zipping back in time to 1969 with his new sidekick, Felicity Shagwell, where nefarious Dr. Evil has stolen his "mojo," the life force that makes him a swinging ladies' man. (cc).

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple attempts to salvage their marriage by inviting three other couples to join them at an island resort. However, everyone is disturbed to discover that participation in therapy sessions is mandatory if they hope to remain at the idyllic paradise. (cc).

programme.title: Weekend at Bernie's
programme.desc: A boss invites two underlings to his beach house with the intention of having them killed because they uncovered his illegal activities. However, when they arrive and discover the boss himself is dead, the pair spends the weekend pretending he's alive so that they can enjoy the place and figure out how to get themselves out of harm's way. (cc).

programme.title: The Cooler
programme.desc: A lifelong loser (William H. Macy), employed by a Las Vegas casino to stop gamblers' hot streaks, gets lucky in love. Deftly acted, well-written drama with Maria Bello and Alec Baldwin (Best Supporting Actor nominee). Directorial debut for co-screenwriter Wayne Kramer, who was nominated for a Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival. (cc).

programme.title: Manhattan
programme.desc: A writer toys with quitting his job; leaving his current wife; and committing to his teenage girlfriend. Meanwhile, he is falling for his best friend's mate; and his lesbian ex-wife has written a tell-all. (cc).

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's bumbling son rises from the fiery depths of hell and enters New York City, where he tries to save the world and his father's life by battling his two supremely evil brothers, who are scheming to upset the balance of good and evil. (cc).

programme.title: The Royal Tenenbaums
programme.desc: A clan's estranged patriarch loses his home and learns that his ex-wife plans to remarry, so he pretends to be dying to win back his family. Although his ex lets him move back in, his three adult children don't react well to their father's return. (cc).

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: Terror comes at a frightening clip when a group of teens have a close brush with death at a racetrack, only to find the Grim Reaper striking back at them with a vengeance. (cc).

programme.title: Once upon a Time in Mexico
programme.desc: A corrupt CIA agent teams up with a guitar-playing gunslinger to stop a coup South of the Border. (cc).

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: After a priceless Rembrandt painting is stolen from a New York skyscraper in a daring and technically sophisticated robbery, an ambitious insurance agent tries to catch a brilliant thief by persuading him to join her in a heist. (cc).

programme.title: The Quiet American
programme.desc: Superbly acted adaptation of Graham Greene's novel about the complex friendship between a British journalist and an American agent in 1952 Vietnam. Michael Caine (who was nominated for an Oscar), Brendan Fraser. Directed by Phillip Noyce on location. A less faithful film version was made in 1958, starring Michael Redgrave and Audie Murphy. (cc).

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. In response, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their hard-earned money back. (cc).

programme.title: Cop Out
programme.desc: Tough New York cop Jimmy Monroe teams up with a crazy partner to recover an expensive baseball card that was stolen from him by a gangster. Jimmy must get it back in order to pay for his daughter's wedding. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Why Him?
programme.desc: An adoring dad is horrified to discover that his daughter's tech-billionaire boyfriend is a tattooed, party-hearty lout. Despite the latter's heart of gold, the father refuses to warm to him—especially when he learns about his engagement plans. (cc).(n)

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: A Hawaii veterinarian falls for a woman with short-term memory loss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: W.
programme.desc: Josh Brolin gives a pitch-perfect performance as President George W. Bush in Oliver Stone's surprisingly restrained biopic tracing Bush's transformation from a privileged, partying frat boy to a born-again Christian and conservative politician. Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, James Cromwell, Richard Dreyfuss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hard Candy
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl (Ellen Page) and a thirtysomething photographer (Patrick Wilson) connect in an on-line chat room and arrange a meeting in this creepily provocative psychodrama that turns into an unsettling tale of retribution. Sandra Oh, Jennifer Holmes. Directed by David Slade. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In 11th-century China, two mercenaries from the West are captured by a military organization that are headquartered in a fortress on the Great Wall. In time, the duo get caught up in a battle between the Chinese warriors and a supernatural menace that the Great Wall was built to repel. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Extreme Ops
programme.desc: Extreme-sports enthusiasts run afoul of a slippery terrorist and his henchmen while filming a commercial in the Austrian Alps. Slick action, absurd plot. Devon Sawa, Rufus Sewell, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Courage Under Fire
programme.desc: “Rashomon”-like flashbacks lend depth to this military drama, which centers on a scrupulous Army officer (Denzel Washington) probing the Gulf War death of a chopper pilot (Meg Ryan). Monfriez: Lou Diamond Phillips. Hershberg: Michael Moriarty. Ilario: Matt Damon. Bruno: Bronson Pinchot. Edward Zwick directed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Stratton
programme.desc: A British Special Boat Service operative named John Stratton is tasked with infiltrating an Iranian facility that contains biochemical weapons. Later, Stratton pursues a former Soviet spy who is planning a terrorist attack in London. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A dying New York real-estate tycoon undergoes a top-secret procedure to transfer his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man, but he discovers that his new life isn't what he expected after severing ties to his old one and learning about the mysterious origins of his new body. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Three women, separated by 80 years, struggle with similar crises linked by the novel Mrs. Dalloway. Author Virginia Woolf attempts to start writing that novel, a '50s housewife contemplates leaving her life behind and a modern-day book editor cares for a former boyfriend who's fighting AIDS. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Love Happens
programme.desc: A widower (Aaron Eckhart) develops feelings for a student (Jennifer Aniston) and is forced to come to terms with his wife's death. John Carroll Lynch, Martin Sheen. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: In this sequel to "Fifty Shades of Grey," the demure Anastasia Steele and possessive businessman Christian Grey pursue a more open and trusting relationship. However, their attempts are threatened by several of his past lovers. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Date Night
programme.desc: Mild-mannered married couple Phil and Claire steal a dinner reservation, which leads to a case of mistaken identity. Turns out the reservation was for a pair of thieves, and now a number of unsavory characters want them dead. If they can survive a wacky and life-threatening night, they may just rediscover the passion missing from their marriage. (cc).

programme.title: October Sky
programme.desc: Before becoming a NASA engineer, Homer Hickam was a curious high-school student from West Virginia. When the Soviet Russia launched the first man-made satellite, Sputnik, in 1957, Homer and his friends began designing their own rockets with dreams of escaping their coal-mining town. (cc).

programme.title: Love and Other Drugs
programme.desc: A free-spirited young woman meets her match in a pharmaceutical salesman, and the couple soon discover that the chemistry between them is more powerful than any drug. (cc).

programme.title: Lions for Lambs
programme.desc: Robert Redford directed and stars in this talky treatise on the U.S. war on terror, intercutting the stories of a liberal professor (Redford), a hawkish U.S. senator (Tom Cruise) and a skeptical journalist (Meryl Streep). Michael Pena, Andrew Garfield, Peter Berg, Kevin Dunn. (cc).

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. Extended edition. (cc).

programme.title: Taps
programme.desc: Military academy cadets take up arms against developers who are plotting to demolish their school. Though a General tries to quell the rebellion, he too is inspired to stand for the school when the Army is called in to rout the boys. (cc).

programme.title: The Guru
programme.desc: An Indian dancer goes to Manhattan to become an actor and finds himself boarding with distant relatives and caught up in a love triangle. (cc).

programme.title: Corky Romano
programme.desc: A bumbling veterinarian joins the FBI so he can destroy evidence against his mob-boss father. (cc).

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic in which human beings are the least-evolved species in the known universe, an ex-soldier protects a seemingly ordinary woman who's been targeted for assassination by a ruthless queen. (cc).

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians The Lightning Thief
programme.desc: Accident-prone teenager Percy discovers he's actually a demigod, the son of Poseidon, and he must master his newfound skills and find Zeus' stolen lightning in order to prevent a war between the Greek gods that could devastate the entire world. (cc).

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio. (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (cc).

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. John was raised to believe in a specific version of the future, but that future begins to shift with the appearance of mysterious former death-row inmate Marcus Wright. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: Action flick about an emergency chief and a geologist who scramble to halt the destruction of L.A. from a volcanic eruption. (cc).

programme.title: Cooties
programme.desc: An outbreak of cooties turns the students at an elementary school into flesh-eating zombies, trapping the faculty inside the building and forcing them to fight for their survival. (cc).

programme.title: The Statement
programme.desc: High-minded but muddled thriller about a former Nazi collaborator (Michael Caine) trying to avoid capture by the French government and death by vengeful assassins in the 1990s. Tilda Swinton. Directed by Norman Jewison. Adapted from Brian Moore's fact-based novel by screenwriter Ronald Harwood. (cc).

programme.title: Invictus
programme.desc: President Nelson Mandela inspires the South African rugby team to strive for the World Cup in hopes of soothing the country's racial tensions. As rugby captain Francois Pienaar leads his team on a winning streak, the people of South Africa are brought together by their collective desire for a major sports victory. (cc).

programme.title: Rush Hour 2
programme.desc: A wisecracking L.A. cop (Chris Tucker) visits his friend the inspector (Jackie Chan) in Hong Kong, and is drawn into a case involving a mob bigwig and a counterfeiting ring. Chan's stunts punch up this predictable crime yarn. A sequel to 1998's “Rush Hour.” Brett Ratner directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Ref
programme.desc: When a cat burglar is ditched by his partner in the middle of a break-in, he takes a bickering Connecticut couple hostage. Seeking to get out of the situation alive, and out of handcuffs, the burglar acts as referee to sort out their family problems. (cc).

programme.title: Like.Share.Follow
programme.desc: An Internet sensation finds himself stalked by an obsessive ''super-fan'' who will stop at nothing to get close to him. (cc).

(cc).

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. (cc).

programme.title: Courage Under Fire

programme.title: King Arthur Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws the legendary sword Excalibur from the stone, and must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago. (cc).

programme.title: Fast and Furious
programme.desc: When fugitive ex-con Dom Toretto returns to Los Angeles seeking the truth behind a high-profile crime, Agent Brian O'Conner reluctantly seeks out his help in order to take down a common enemy. Speeding from the streets of L.A. into the Mexican desert in convoy heists and precision tunnel crawls, Dom and Brian attempt to get their man while exploring thrilling new frontiers in the fine art of racing. (cc).

programme.title: The Beach
programme.desc: An American vacationer and a French couple find danger on a secluded island paradise off the coast of Thailand. (cc).

programme.title: Totem
programme.desc: A teen goes to extremes to shield her family from a supernatural menace. (cc).

programme.title: The Broken
programme.desc: A woman is thrust into a world where everything is subtly unfamiliar in this thriller starring Lena Headey. Gina McVey is enjoying dinner with her family and her boyfriend Stefan when a mirror shatters without cause. The next day Gina sees a woman who looks like her own doppelganger. Curious, Gina sneaks into the woman's apartment and sees a photo of herself and her father. Later, Gina notices that Stefan is not the same and begins having horrific nightmares. (cc).

programme.title: From Mexico With Love
programme.desc: Self-destructive migrant laborer Hector Villa (Kuno Becker) seeks to follow in his father's footsteps by making a name for himself as an amateur boxer. When Hector's mother dies, he vows to honor her memory by defeating the toughest boxer around. (cc).

programme.title: Big Fish
programme.desc: A chronicle of the life of Edward Bloom, a garrulous Southerner whose tall tales have always alienated his no-nonsense son, Will. But with Edward near death, Will must come to terms with his father and his stories before it's too late. (cc).

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Thrilling adventure yarn about eight sled dogs struggling to survive when bad weather leaves them marooned at an Antarctic research post. The fact-based film is similar to the 1983 Japanese film "Nankyoku Monogatari," which was released in the U.S. as "Antarctica." (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: A teen must leap the space-time continuum to 1885 in the DeLorean time machine in order to rescue its inventor, whose 70-year-old letter reveals that he has retired to the Old West to live out his days there. Upon arriving, the boy finds the scientist in love and in danger. (cc).

programme.title: Romeo Must Die
programme.desc: Violent take on “Romeo and Juliet” centering on the love affair between a Chinese escaped prisoner (Jet Li) and the daughter of the head of a black crime syndicate. The action packs a punch, but the script is packed with clichés. Pop star Aaliyah (1979-2001) costars and performs four songs on the soundtrack. Isaiah Washington. Andrzej Bartkowiak directed. (cc).

programme.title: My Little Eye
programme.desc: In this British thriller, five contestants on a reality show spend six months together in an isolated house. They begin to turn on each other after the arrival of a stranger and a gun loaded with five bullets. (cc).

programme.desc: PI Andre Shame becomes embroiled in a web of danger while searching for a fortune in missing drug money. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure based on Greek mythology, a courageous warrior named Perseus vows to defeat Hades in order to prevent the god of the underworld from overthrowing Zeus, thereby turning Earth into a living hell. A man of godly origins, Perseus watched in agony as Hades took his family, but now, with a small band of warriors by his side, he battles mythical creatures while tapping into his god-like abilities to take control of his own fate. programme.title: Edge of Darkness

Meanwhile, mysterious government agent Darius Jedburgh sets out to erase all evidence of the crime. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Green Zone

programme.title: The Pelican Brief

programme.title: Four Christmases

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: Action flick about an emergency chief and a geologist who scramble to halt the destruction of L.A. from a volcanic eruption. (cc).

programme.title: Final Destination

programme.title: Lions for Lambs

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: A tale of the adventures of a poor boy and four bratty children, who win a tour of a mysterious chocolate factory. Their personal guide is the eccentric owner named Willy Wonka.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Prom Video
programme.desc: Monica brings some things home from her parents' house, including a prom video; Rachel tells Ross that she doesn't think it will work out between them. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel...You Know
programme.desc: Ross's work hinders the evolution of his and Rachel's romance; Monica has eyes for an older opthalmologist (Tom Selleck); Joey and Chandler enjoy a big-screen TV. Ross: David Schwimmer. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Moves Out
programme.desc: Richard's relationship with a younger woman causes a stir at a party for Ross and Monica's dad; Joey decides to move out; Rachel gets a tattoo. Richard: Tom Selleck. Jack: Elliott Gould. Judy: Christina Pickles. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Moves In
programme.desc: Chandler gets a new roommate; Monica doesn't like having Ross around all the time; Phoebe makes a music video. Eddie: Adam Goldberg. Monica: Courteney Cox. Ross: David Schwimmer. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Dr. Ramoray Dies
programme.desc: The days in the life of Joey's character, Dr. Ramoray, are numbered; Chandler's new roommate scares him. Richard: Tom Selleck. Eddie: Adam Goldberg. Tilly: Mary Gallagher. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Tantric Sex and the Sprouted Flute
programme.desc: Christy annoys everyone when she adopts her new boyfriend's healthy lifestyle. Meanwhile, Bonnie and Adam decide to move to the next level in their relationship. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: A Cricket and a Hedge Made of Gold
programme.desc: Marjorie takes a break from the group, so Bonnie becomes the go-to person for everyone's problems. Also, Christy faces a painful memory from her past. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: A Few Thongs and a Hawaiian Funeral
programme.desc: Christy and Jill take Emily to see her biological mother in rehab, and make a surprising discovery. Meanwhile, Bonnie watches Adam's dog while he is out of town. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.desc: Season 4 ends with Bonnie getting into trouble with the IRS. Christy tries to help her but soon realizes she is in over her head, so she suggests Bonnie seek help from her newfound brother, Ray. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: George drops his community-college course because it's too hard, but he can't tell the family because he doesn't want to set a bad example for Max, who has finally begun to study in school. Professor Lim: Ming-Na. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: The Kidney Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: Angie doesn't like how George instructs Max about having a girlfriend. But Max's bed-wetting is indicative of a further problem. Dr. Woodson: Ken Howard. Kristi: Ashly Holloway. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: A Funeral Brings George to His Niece
programme.desc: Angie's rich former sister-in-law dies and leaves everything to her spoiled 20-year-old daughter, Veronica (Aimee Garcia). But she can't get her money until George---who's the trustee of the will---decides she's mature enough to handle it. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Gets Caught in a Powers Play
programme.desc: George decides to teach his rich niece Veronica (Aimee Garcia) a lesson in the value of honest labor by getting her a job at the factory. Trouble is, the men want to do all of her work, and the boss (Mark Tymchyshyn) wants to do something else with her. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica throws her support behind Walter Mondale in 1984's presidential election and tries to get Beverly to vote with her, but to no avail. Meanwhile, Barry is determined to get on an athletic game show to prove his prowess after losing a wrestling match. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly arranges for Adam's teacher to tutor him in Spanish, a class she can't believe he's failing; at the same time, Barry gets a job delivering pizzas to impress Murray, but meanwhile, Erica is upset that her father hasn't acknowledged the fact that she has been working throughout her teen years. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Tutor Sauce; Lost in Bikini Bottom
programme.desc: SpongeBob gets driving lessons from Mr. Krabs; SpongeBob tries a shortcut to work, but he winds up getting lost. (repeat).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob fears he's caught Squidward's illness, not knowing that Squidward was only faking it; Mrs. Puff enters SpongeBob in a demolition derby. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Whale of a Birthday; Karate Island
programme.desc: Mr. Krabs intends on throwing Pearl a fantastic birthday bash, but on a miserly budget; SpongeBob helps with the festivities by picking out Pearl's present. Later, SpongeBob vies to be crowned King of Karate. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Teeny Penguin; Pups Save the Cat Show
programme.desc: Jake and Everest rescue a little penguin who ends up floating out to the sea on a homemade bridge. Katie's muddy kittens may ruin the cat show. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Tiny Creatures; Daddy Pig's Office; Pirate Island; George Catches a Cold; The Balloon Ride
programme.desc: Peppa plays in her grandfather's garden; Peppa and George spend the day at work with their dad; Peppa's grandparents take her and her pals on a boat trip to an island; George comes down with a cold; Peppa wins a ride in a hot-air balloon. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Sailing Boat; Molly Mole; Soft Play; The Market; Bedtime Story
programme.desc: Peppa and George go sailing with Grandpa Pig; it's Molly Mole's first day at school, and she quickly becomes best friends with Peppa and Rebecca Rabbit; George is invited to Richard Rabbit's birthday party. (repeat).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: Deema dislikes broccoli, and this becomes a problem when she must attain a broccoli badge in order to complete her scout-troop initiation. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: When Bubble Puppy's doghouse is destroyed, the Guppies and the entire neighborhood pitch in to build a new dream home. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Top Wing
programme.sub-title: Penny Rescues a Treasure; Penny Rocks the Road Wing
programme.desc: Penny races to save the lost treasure of Shipwreck Cove and Commodore Smurkturkski; Rod has to stay in bed with a cold, and Penny has to learn to pilot the Road-Wing on the fly. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save Baby Humdinger; Pups Save a Pinata
programme.desc: Tracker has a dream that Mayor Humdinger turns into a baby, and it's up to the pups to find the special coconut to reverse the spell; Alex hosts a party in Adventure Bay, but he's heartbroken when his special piñata mysteriously disappears. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Rocky Saves Himself; Pups and the Mystery of the Driverless Snocat
programme.desc: Rocky must rescue himself when he gets stranded on an island full of trash; Daring Danny's new remote control accidentally takes control of Everest's SnoCat and all the vehicles in Adventure Bay. (repeat).

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Blaze and Starla find a map to a legendary track, so they set out on a Wild West quest to locate the Bouncing Bull Racetrack and take the ride of their lives. (repeat).

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Blaze transforms into a tow-truck and with the help of AJ and Gabby sets off on a tow-tally adventure to save Stripes. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Bookmobile; Pups Save Heady Humdinger

programme.desc: Sharp cartoon comedy chronicling the trials of proud Texas propane salesman Hank Hill, his family and their ragtag neighbors. From Mike Judge, the mind behind MTV's 'Beavis and Butt-head,' this one has heart where the other had guts, and fit nicely on Fox's Sunday-night lineup with 'The Simpsons' when it debuted in midseason in 1997. Judge's cocreator is `The Simpsons' former executive producer, Greg Daniels. (cc).
